intro: Jacquiniella, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in the southwestern United States and Mexico. Jacquiniella species typically grow in dry, rocky habitats and are often found in desert or semi-arid environments. They have small, narrow leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
